alert.note: Alert for Carteret; Dare; Hyde; Tyrrell; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 04 at 3:25PM EST until January 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EST FOR WASHINGTON...HYDE...DARE...TYRRELL AND NORTHEASTERN CARTERET COUNTIES... At 325 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Roper to near Fort Landing to 8 miles east of South River, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Plymouth, Stumpy Point, Cedar Island, Killkenny, Manns Harbor, Gull Rock, Alligator, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Fairfield, Mashoes, Manteo, New Holland, Columbia, East Lake, Woodley, Nebraska, Lake Landing, Middletown and Newfoundland. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
